translations.translation: In both of them there will be every kind of fruits in pairs. --
In both these is a pair of every fruit.
In them there are pairs of each kind of fruit.
In which are fruits of all kinds, each of two varieties.
In them (both) will be every kind of fruit in pairs.
In both of them are two pairs of every fruit.
therein of every fruit two kinds --
Wherein is every kind of fruit in pairs.
In both of them, there will be two kinds of every fruit.
In which will be of every fruit two kinds.
In both of them will be two kinds of every fruit.
In them will be Fruits of every kind, two and two.
In them (both) will be every kind of fruit in pairs.
Therein are two kinds of every fruit.
In them are fruits of every kind, in pairs.
In both of them are of every fruit, two kinds.

[55:52] In both of them, of every fruit (fākiha) of [the fruits of] this world — or [it, fākiha, means] all those things in which one delights (yutafakkahu bihi) — there are two kinds, two varieties, one juicy, one dried, and those which in this world are bitter, like colocynth, will be sweet [therein].
(Wherein is every kind of fruit in pairs) both with regard to shape and taste.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { فِيهِمَا } أي: في تلك الجنتين { مِن كُلِّ فَاكِهَةٍ زَوْجَانِ } [الرحمن: 52] صنفان من المعارف والحقائق على مقتضى تربية العينان والمذكرتان، { فَبِأَيِّ آلاۤءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ } [الرحمن: 53] أيها المسخران تحت لطفه وقهره وجلاله وجماله

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
وعن الحسن: تجريان بالماء الزلال، إحداهما: التسنيم، والأخرى: السلسبيل، وقيل: بالماء والخمر، { فبأي آلاء ربكما تُكذِّبان } ، { فيهما من كل فاكهةٍ زوجان } صنفان، صنف معروف وصنف غريب، أو رطب ويابس
 { فبأي آلاء ربكما تُكَذِّبان }
